Title: ADC calls Tinubu’s NNPCL debt write-off unconstitutional, warns of revenue loss
Summary: African Democratic Congress (ADC) condemns President Bola Ahmed Tinubu’s approval of the cancellation of legacy debts owed by the Nigerian National Petroleum Company Limited (NNPC Ltd) to the Federation Account, warning that the move is unconstitutional and financially financially disastrous .

Title: The last minutes: Anthony Joshua visits funeral home, pays final respects to Sina, Latif
Summary: Anthony Joshua ordered that the remains of his two associates, Sina Ghami and Latif Ayodele, be brought back to TOS Funeral home few minutes before Joshua paid final respects to them . Joshua visited funeral home, paid last respects to Sina, Latif .

Title: Club raises funds for ICT skills centre at charity ball
Summary: The GoodFellas International Club (GFI) of Nibo, a non-profit and non-political organisation, has announced plans to build a state-of-the-art Information and Communication Technology (ICT) and Innovative Skills Development Centre as part of its community development and youth empowerment initiatives .

Title: Governor Sani has not borrowed funds to finance projects — commissioner
Summary: Kaduna State Governor, Uba Sani, has not borrowed funds to execute projects since he assumed office . 2026 budget will be financed without borrowing, Commissioner of Planning and Budget, Mutktar Ahmed Monrovia said .

Title: Grok faces backlash over alleged generation of erotic images involving minors
Summary: Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence chatbot, Grok, has come under intense scrutiny following complaints that it was used to turn images of children and women into erotic content . Grok faces backlash over alleged generation of erotic images involving minors .

Title: Minister Adelabu pledges reliable power supply in 2026
Summary: Adebayo Adelabu has assured Nigerians that the Federal Government’s priority in 2026 is reliable, accessible and sustainable electricity supply .

Title: AVIATION: High, low moments in 2025
Summary: Four days to the end of the year, 2025 would remain indelible in the minds of stakeholders in the air transport sector on account of events that kept the industry under scrutiny .

Title: Colombia deploys troops to Venezuela border after US attacks
Summary: Petro described Washington's actions as an "assault on the sovereignty" of Latin America . Petro said the actions would result in a humanitarian crisis .

Title: Amidst push for Bori State, oil may flow in Ogoniland 30 years on
Summary: It's been over three decades since oil exploration was stopped in Ogoniland . Fresh indications suggest crude production may resume . Oil exploration was halted 30 years ago, but fresh indications suggest it could resume .

Title: 2025: A lost year for Nigeria’s health sector – NMA
Summary: As the curtain closed on 2025, Nigeria’s federal health sector stood at a crossroads, weighed down by unmet expectations, policy drift and a steadily weakening healthcare delivery system .

Title: Anthony Joshua's friends' funeral to hold in London mosque on Sunday
Summary: The Janaza prayer service for Sina Ghami and Abdul Latif Kevin Ayodele is scheduled to take place on Sunday, January 4, 2026 . The service will begin at 10am at the London Central Mosque, 146 Park Road, London NW8 7RG . Joshua was also involved in a road crash in Nigeria late last

Title: US bombs Venezuela capital, captures leader Maduro — Trump
Summary: President Donald Trump hails a ‘brilliant’ operation by US forces in Venezuela . President Maduro and his wife captured and flown out of the country, he says . Venezuela's government accuses the U.S. of an “extremely serious military aggression” which follows a months-long campaign of increasing military and economic

Title: Youths protest at Obaseki family home over disrespect to Benin palace
Summary: Aiguobasinmwin Movement Worldwide, Iyamu Osaro, also known as Culture and Coordinator, Otedo Youth Union, Uwadiae Iyoha, issued a joint statement warning against actions that undermine the sacredness of the Benin royal palace . The group said they would not watch the sacred royal

Title: Use pulpit to preach peace, not division, CAN warns clerics
Summary: The Chairman of the Christian Association of Nigeria in Taraba State, Very Rev. Dr. Fr. Williams Awoshiri, has cautioned Christian leaders against turning the pulpit into a platform for division, hate, or political insults . He urged them to uphold its sanctity as a place for peace, moral guidance, and responsible engagement with

Title: London black taxis gain as UK ends VAT loophole
Summary: Tax loophole that allowed big app-based minicab firms to undercut black cab drivers . Change means everyone is now playing by same rules, helping protect drivers’ livelihoods and raising around £700 million a year to support public services and ease pressure on cost of living .
